alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 6:57AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. Tammany Parish, northwestern Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 656 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Bush, or 12 miles west of Picayune, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Picayune, Covington, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Bush, Mcneil and Lacombe. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 58 and 73. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 9 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
